choiceA.text: Give a rousing speech in support of the diplomat. (Choice A can lead to **A Higher Duty, Part 2**)

choiceB.text: Give a neutral speech to avoid sides. (Choice B can lead to **A Higher Duty, Part 2**)

choiceC.text: Refuse to speak at the diplomat's gala.

choiceA.text: Suggest a lenient sentence in the hopes of reform.

choiceB.text: Suggest a harsh sentence in light of the consequences of his theft. (Choice B can lead to **A Higher Duty, Part 3**)

choiceA.text: Disable his ship before he can harm the colony.

choiceB.text: Talk him down before he or anyone else is hurt.

choiceA.text: Encourage the young Trill to join Starfleet (Choice A can lead to **A Life Alone, Part 2**)

choiceB.text: Advise the young Trill to look for purpose elsewhere.

choiceA.text: Tell him to remain at Starfleet Academy.
reward: 3 :star: Crew OR **Jannar** OR 600 Ship Schematics <!--NX-01 Schematics-->

choiceB.text: Tell him to return home for the joining.

choiceA.text: Tell him a palatable version of the truth.

choiceB.text: Lie to him.

choiceA.text: Avoid taking sides in the rebellion.

choiceB.text: Support the colony's governor.

choiceA.text: Protect the Andorian by stunning the Gorn. (Choice A unlocks Choice B of **Friends in Need**)

choiceB.text: Protect the Gorn by stunning the Andorian. (Choice B unlocks Choice C of **Friends in Need**)

choiceA.text: Encourage him to gather definitive proof before accusing the Ardanan.

choiceB.text: Urge him to arrest the suspect before she can flee the system.

choiceC.text: Share the secret correspondences we received from the Ardanan's servant.  (Requires Choice B in **Class Act**)

choiceA.text: Repay the outpost for what **crew name**'s counterpart took.

choiceB.text: Reassure the outpost's inhabitants that **crew name** means them no harm.

choiceA.text: Reveal their leader's true identity. (Choice A can lead to **Champion of the People, Part 2**)

choiceB.text: Allow the colonists to continue following her.

choiceA.text: Arrest all of the mercenaries for attacking the crew.

choiceB.text: Give the Ventaxian a chance to flee. (Choice B can lead to **Champion of the People, Part 3**)

choiceA.text: Reinforce the Ventaxian colony.

choiceB.text: Encourage the former mercenary and the colonists to work together.

choiceA.text: Support the respectable Ardanan's accusations.

choiceB.text: Defend the frightened servant. (Choice B unlocks Choice C of **Burden of Proof**)

choiceA.text: Cross the border and assist the Romulan interceptor. (Choice A may lead to Choice C in **First Author**)

choiceB.text: Ensure that the distress call reaches another Romulan ship. (Choice B may lead to Choice C in **First Author**)

choiceA.text: Tip the captain off.

choiceB.text: Try to persuade the crew plotting a potential mutiny.

choiceA.text: Allow the researcher to claim the doctor's work.

choiceB.text: Attempt to warn the Romulan doctor.

choiceC.text: The captain of the Romulan interceptor we assisted is at the conference. Ask her to warn the doctor. (Requires Choice A or B in **Cracks in the Wall**)

choiceA.text: Negotiate with the guards for freedom.

choiceB.text: Ask the Andorian we rescued to distract the guards. (If you saved the Andorian in **Blow by Blow**)

choiceC.text: Ask the Gorn we rescued to fight the guards. (If you saved the Gorn in **Blow by Blow**)

choiceA.text: Leave the substance on the planet where it was found.

choiceB.text: Take a sample back to the **ship name** for further study. (Choice B may lead to **Interference, Part 2**)

choiceA.text: Lure the substance out without harming it.
reward: Crew (3 :star:, other 4 :star:) OR **Lucien**) OR 600 Ship Schematics

choiceB.text: Dissolve the substance before it reaches the impulse engines.

choiceA.text: Defend the Vorta passenger.

choiceB.text: Return the Vorta passenger to the Dominion.

choiceA.text: Search for the ship or any other survivors.

choiceB.text: Tell the survivor I cannot take the risk.

choiceA.text: Retrieve it.

choiceB.text: Leave it.

choiceA.text: Take the stowaway to see his family.

choiceB.text: Arrest the Maquis stowaway.

choiceC.text: Leave the stowaway at the nearest outpost.

choiceA.text: Allow the supposed agent to use the **ship name**. (Choice A may lead to **Off the Books, Part 2**)

choiceB.text: Refuse the supposed agent's demands.

choiceA.text: Transport the wounded agent to sickbay.

choiceB.text: Transport the agent to the brig.
reward: 3 :star: Crew OR **Thot Gor** OR 600 Ship Schematics

choiceC.text: Leave the agent to face the enemies she has made.

choiceA.text: Contact the Romulans and demand that they reverse course.

choiceB.text: Open fire on the trespassing Romulan warbird.

choiceA.text: Give the mining rights to the colonists, who own this star system.

choiceB.text: Give the mining rights to the Ferengi company, who found the deposit.

choiceA.text: Use patience and empathy to get through to him.

choiceB.text: Take the officer back to the ship by force.

choiceC.text: Turn the situation over to Starfleet higher-ups.

choiceA.text: Give the space to **crew name** for auxiliary deflector array. (Choice A unlocks Choice B of **The Tools at Hand**)

choiceB.text: Give the space to **crew name** for torpedo development. (Choice B unlocks Choice C of **The Tools at Hand**)

choiceA.text: Endure the Klingon captain's insults.

choiceB.text: Insult the drunken captain for his behavior.

choiceC.text: Correct the offensive rumors the Klingon captain has heard.

title: The Beginning of the End of the World

choiceA.text: Debate the vedek (Choice A may lead to **The Voice of the Prophets**)

choiceB.text: Reassure the crowd that they are safe.

choiceC.text: Allow the vedek to share his beliefs.

choiceA.text: Make the surface habitable for the Yalosians once again.

choiceB.text: Leave the planet's life to develop without interfering.

choiceA.text: Continue to help the colonist search for a cure

choiceB.text: Refuse to help until the colony's doctors have stopped these experiments.

choiceC.text: Leave the colonists to find a cure on their own

choiceA.text: Confiscate the stolen items.

choiceB.text: Allow the scavenger to leave with what she has taken.

choiceA.text: Distract the probe with phaser fire.

choiceB.text: Disable the probe with **crew name**'s new deflector array. (Requires Choice A in **Retrofit**)

choiceC.text: Destroy the probe with **crew name**'s new experimental torpedo. (Requires Choice B in **Retrofit**)

choiceA.text: Ask the vedek to hand over the Orb.

choiceB.text: Stun him before he can open the Orb.

choiceC.text: Convince the vedek that he does not need the Orb's visions. (Requires Choice A from **The Beginning of the End of the World**)
reward: 3 :star: Crew OR **The Clown** OR 600 Ship Schematics

choiceA.text: Recommend the commander for promotion

choiceB.text: Advise Against promoting the commander.

choiceC.text: Decline to comment on the potential promotion.

choiceA.text: Allow the trader to board the **ship name**.

choiceB.text: Tell the trader to make other arrangements.

choiceA.text: Evacuate the station for as long as possible, allowing it to crash.

choiceB.text: Destroy the station before it can impact the planet's surface.

choiceA.text: Save the captain.

choiceB.text: Save the prisoner.
